noun.description: A spectator or reader of inferior taste, such as a member of a theater audience who traditionally stood in the pit below the stage.
A person on the ground as opposed to one in a spacecraft or aircraft.
A fish that lives at the bottom of lakes and streams, especially a gudgeon or loach.

origin: Early 17th century (denoting a fish): from ground + -ling; compare with Dutch grondeling, German Gründling gudgeon.
